entry.title: Discussion for Home page
entry.summary:
Bin Tu,

The appropriate place to ask for help is on the mailing list at

pdb2pqr-users@lists.sourceforge.net

Post your question there and I'll reply to it on that forum. After you have sent your message I will delete these comments.

-Kyle

entry.title: Discussion for Home page
entry.summary:
Hi all,
I have created a simple ssDNA poly(dC)_50 using make-na software (the pdb file is attached).

When I tried to convert the pdb2pqr of my DNA, there is a error:

Error parsing line: invalid literal for int() with base 10: 'ori'
<REMARK original="" generated="" coordinate="" pdb="" file="">
DEBUG INFO: PDBInputError /home/d3y382/apbs-pdb2pqr/pdb2pqr/build/pdb2pqr/out00-PYZ.pyz/src.routines: 619
Error encountered: No heavy atoms found!

Which option should I choose to convert this pdb file to pqr file by web server
PDB2PQR?
or which command should I use to convert this pdb file to pqr file by local PDB2PQR?

Thanks !

Best wishes
Bin Tu
